Pesawat NASA Lewati 'Ujung Dunia', Begini Kondisi di Sana
07 Nov 2019, 12:04 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Ilustrasi. Foto: NASA

Florida - Sejarak 18 miliar kilometer dari Bumi, ada batas yang menandai tepian jangkauan sinar Matahari atau tepi Tata Surya kita dan permulaan dari ruang antar bintang, interstellar, ujung dunia yang misterius. Pesawat NASA, Voyager 2, menembus batas yang super jauh tersebut tahun silam dan kini apa yang ia temukan dipaparkan ilmuwan.Voyager 2 sudah terbang lebih dari 40 tahun yang lalu. Ia menjadi wahana antariksa kedua yang sampai di tepi Tata Surya setelah Voyager 1. Voyager 2 sebenarnya diluncurkan sebulan lebih awal tapi tiba lebih lambat karena jalurnya lebih jauh. Ia sempat menjepret planet Uranus dan Venus dari jarak dekat.Voyager 2 telah meninggalkan heliosphere, yaitu area antariksa dengan Matahari di pusatnya. Hebatnya, perangkat penelitian masih berfungsi dengan baik walau sudah beberapa dekade usianya."Wahana Voyager menunjukkan pada kita bagaimana Matahari berinteraksi dengan benda yang memenuhi antariksa di antara bintang-bintang dan galaksi Bima Sakti," kata Ed Stone, ilmuwan dan profesor fisika di Caltech.Dikutip detikINET dari Universe Today, baik Voyager 1 dan Voyager 2 menunjukkan bahwa plasma, substansi mirip gas, di ruang antar bintang lebih padat dibandingkan di heliosphere. Diketahui pula bahwa plasma antar bintang lebih dingin suhunya.Batas antara heliosphere dengan ruang antar bintang disebut sebagai heliopause. "Kami melihat bahwa kepadatan plasma di heliopause meningkat dalam jumlah sangat besar," ucap Profesor Daon Gurnett dari University of Iowa. Penemuan tersebut mengindikasikan pula bahwa heliosphere berbentuk simetris. Voyager 2 juga mendukung temuan Voyager 1 jika medan magnet di heliopause paralel dengan medan magnet di dalam heliosphere.Dengan data yang didapat dari Voyager 2, ilmuwan juga mencoba memahami bagaimana angin Matahari berinteraksi dengan angin antar bintang, yang terdiri dari partikel partikel dari bintang lain.Terdapat batas yang jelas antara heliosphere dengan ruang antar bintang. "Ide lama bahwa angin surya secara gradual hilang menuju ruang antar bintang tidak benar. Ditunjukkan oleh Voyager 2 dan sebelumnya Voyager 1 bahwa ada batas yang jelas di sana," cetus Don.Voyager 2 tidak pernah diprediksi akan bertahan dan mencapai perjalanan sejauh itu. NASA Plane Passes 'Edge of the World', Here's the Conditions There
07 Nov 2019, 12:04 by Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Illustration. Photo: NASA

Florida - 18 billion kilometers from Earth, there is a boundary marking the edge of the sun's rays or the edge of our Solar System and the beginning of interstellar space, interstellar, the mysterious end of the world. NASA's Voyager 2 aircraft crossed the super-far boundary last year and now what he discovered was exposed by scientists. Voyager 2 flew more than 40 years ago. It became the second spacecraft to arrive at the edge of the Solar System after Voyager 1. Voyager 2 was actually launched a month earlier but arrived later because the path was farther. He had snapped the planet Uranus and Venus from close range. Voyager 2 has left the heliosphere, which is the space area with the Sun at its center. Remarkably, the research device is still functioning well even though it is several decades old. "The Voyager vehicle shows us how the Sun interacts with matter that fills space between the stars and the Milky Way galaxy," said Ed Stone, scientist and professor of physics at Caltech. Quoted from Universe Today, both Voyager 1 and Voyager 2 show that plasma, a gas-like substance, in interstellar space is denser than in the heliosphere. It is also known that interstellar plasma is colder in temperature. The limit between heliosphere and interstellar space is called heliopause. "We see that plasma density in heliopause increases in very large numbers," said Professor Daon Gurnett of the University of Iowa. These findings also indicate that the heliosphere is symmetrical. Voyager 2 also supports the findings of Voyager 1 if the magnetic field in the heliopause is parallel with the magnetic field in the heliosphere. With data obtained from Voyager 2, scientists are also trying to understand how the solar wind interacts with interstellar wind, which consists of particles from other stars. There is a clear boundary between heliosphere and interstellar space. "The old idea that solar wind is gradually disappearing into interstellar space is not true. It was shown by Voyager 2 and earlier Voyager 1 that there is a clear boundary there," said Don. Voyager 2 was never predicted to survive and reach that far.
